column5: ~~~Was at the Talbot swing bridge on past Saturday, relaxing using Micro bait to catch Micro phishes. notice this one person phishen using 2 rods, suggested to him that he had too many rods, and was told to FO, so I continue relaxing, then a party of 10 showed up with their gear and head down the wall toward the mouth(thank you), glance off to my and here comes the MNR Officer, asked me for my Lic. and I informed him I was a lucky one I'm a Senior. He carried on asked my neigbour, and question him on the extra rod, the guy had not even made an effort to get it out of the water, them when asked for his Lic. he only had one up to 2014. As he was being written up the Party of 10 came back to their cars and left, I could only wonder why, it was a beautiful day
Nice. Those are the priceless days.
love it!  and too bad the 10 were not asked 'so how was the fishing?'
I am seeing this more and more...Does MNR not have the ability to ask the 10 to stay where they are and check them after he wrote up the first guy?
